entry.title: futile devices
entry.summary:
Author: al_lion_e

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,533Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 70

Summary: “That’s gonna get infected.” Comes a voice from down the alley, cold and disinterested. You freeze, and look up. “Oh.” “I mean,” says a man in a recognizable red helmet, “unless you disinfect it. Gothams dumpsters carry germs scientists haven’t even discovered.” He's leaning against the brick wall to your right near the entrance of the alley, his broad, intimidating figure literally blotting out the lights beyond. It's strange to see him so close up- in person, not in blurry photographs in magazines, or on the news.   Or: Encounters.

entry.title: The House hunger built
entry.summary:
Author: FearTheHime

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,194Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 331

Summary: "Of course I eat people, I mean...It's not something I would broadcast since it's...well Gotham and they began to make a phad about it because the citizens are brilliantly...stupid."Bodies are piling up, whatever is left. Families; different backgrounds, different ethnics, religions, looks are being eaten and whatever is left into a master piece. Some sort of art with the remains and everyone was losing time and leads to find out who has been feasting upon Gotham citizens. Jason however, knew of a Cannibal that he totally never mentioned to Bruce. It's not Jason's fault he died before revealing his darkest discovery and that discovery is in the form of a boy he had left behind. [M/N] [L/N]; Mortitan, brilliant, a chef of his own making and conisear of flesh.All Jason needed to do is sweeten the deal in a way that drives all people, after all at the end of the day {M/N] is human after all."Besides..it's people...they are literally born every day..so who cares if a few of them...just disapear once in a while?"

entry.title: Strawberry Waffles
entry.summary:
Author: lushescape

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 47,207Chapters: 17/?Kudos: 826

Summary: “Like a date?” You ask in a near whisper. Jason looks like he's been electrocuted but slowly he nods his head twice. “Yeah. A date. You and me, the school dance.” Oh. Your heart feels like it's beating so fast it's going to stop at any second. But you nod, your face warm, and there's no way you can stop yourself from smiling now. “Um, y- yeah.” You stammer before clearing your throat softly. “Yes.” You say, more confident in your answer. “Yes, I would.. love to go with you. On a date. To the dance.” Or Jason Todd becomes a girl dad after dying and coming back to life

entry.title: I Look in People's Windows
entry.summary:
Author: emmacchiatoo

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,556Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 8

Summary: Sol Alvarez-Ferrer didn’t come to Gotham to be a headline.She came to observe. New city, new job, and a last name people recognize before they recognize her. Armed with a camera, a notebook, and a habit of noticing what others overlook, Sol begins to map a city that watches back. Gotham doesn’t give itself away easily. Some people notice her.Some linger.Some protect her from the shadows. And once you notice someone—it’s hard to look away.

entry.title: Attention
entry.summary:
Author: LicoricexWitch

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 28,618Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 154

Summary: You've always been obsessed with superheroes, ever since you were a little kid. You moved to Gotham all alone with stars in your eyes for undergrad before the cold reality of city-living set in. The streets were mean and people weren't as kind as they were back home. It was hard to make friends and you preferred to stay inside, making you even lonelier. You were a regular fish out of water, not a lot of close friends or family, living all alone--the perfect target for someone with not-so-nice intentions. They always said not to meet your heroes because they could never live up to your expectations. Or sometimes, they weren't a hero at all.

entry.title: In the Lowlight
entry.summary:
Author: magpietendencies (writtenintostars)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,820Chapters: 3/28Kudos: 65

Summary: There’s nothing recognizable about Jason, except maybe the way he zeroes in on you the second you step into the room. He always treated you that way, like you were what he was waiting for, the only reason he even showed up. “Jason.” You say when you remember how to talk again. You’re vaguely aware that you’re digging your nails into your palms. You tell yourself to blink, your eyes beginning to water, but you can’t bring yourself to, afraid you’ll find that Jason won’t be there anymore. “Hey, Mags,” the figure greets you, and it’s the first time anyone’s called you that in years. It makes sense that it would be Jason who uses the nickname. He gave it to you, after all. ~ You and Jason Todd spent your teen years together under Batman's tutelage and Bruce Wayne's care, your bond going much further than any words can describe. Six years after his apparent death, Jason reappears, both of you angry and dejected, teeming with love you don't know what to do with. You missed each other. ~ Updates the first Monday of each month.
